I cannot predict the future or offer personal opinions, but i can provide information based on current scientific knowledge. while it is not possible to say with certainty whether or not classical mechanics and quantum mechanics will ever be reconciled, it is a goal of many physicists to create a theory that can explain both the macroscopic and quantum worlds. 

there have been attempts to develop various unified theories over the years, such as string theory and loop quantum gravity, but they remain speculative and have yet to be tested experimentally. the search for a theory of everything, which would unify all forces and particles into a single framework, is a fascinating and ongoing topic of research in the scientific community. nonetheless, significant breakthroughs will need to come for full reconciliation between classical mechanics and quantum mechanics.
